bug.author: jlewi
bug.summary: kfctl_existing_arrikto doesn't create a username/password by default
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: I installed kubeflow using kfctl_existing_arrikto.yaml following the instructions <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-existing-arrikto/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-existing-arrikto/</denchmark-link>
I was expecting that a username/password would be created using the environment variables KUBEFLOW_USERNAME and KUBEFLOW_PASSWORD. But after deploying kubeflow I could not login using that username and password. Looking at the dex configmap it doesn't look like there is any user specified. <denchmark-code>issuer: https://35.231.133.227:5556/dex storage: type: kubernetes config: inCluster: true web: http: 0.0.0.0:5556 oauth2: skipApprovalScreen: true enablePasswordDB: true
staticClients: - id: kubeflow-authservice-oidc redirectURIs: # After authenticating and giving consent, dex will redirect to # this url for the specific client. - https://35.231.133.227/login/oidc name: 'Kubeflow AuthService OIDC' secret: <...> # Options for controlling the logger. logger: level: "debug" format: "text"
</denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: Expected Dex to be configured with the username and password I set Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.6.2-rc.2 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) GKE Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link>
